item.title: cv+resume

I respect in the impact of gene and environment and try single healthy experiment on myself to understand some hard theories. item.title: Untitle
item.description: Decision Tree HackerRank vue meeting contigency table leedcode report of from the \(X_t\),\(y_t\) are good performance. But has high false positive rate in the testing data. Why? random forest are able to reduce the variance a plot x (epoch), y(loss) group by the different learning rate: 01, and 1e-10. the first group decrease and increasing at one point, the second decrease steeply and converge at a certain point.

item.title: Leedcode
item.description: Leedcode 67: Add Binary Given two string a and b, return their sum as a binary string. Input: a = '101', b = '111' Output: '1100' Idea: 1. ans can use list and string as the result in a string. if use the string: + if use the list need to add the "".join()[::-1] at the end while loop instead the for loop: the length is unsure, both use the index

item.title: Experimental Design
item.description: Some concepts and examples in Experimental Design experimental study: a study subject is assigned the treatment observational study: a study with subject is observed or measured experimental unit: in an experimental study, basic entity can be assigned is called experimental unit. The experimental unit is people, called subject. At observational and experimental study, subjects are called participants. Experimental Design A good experimental design will need: 1. treatments are random assigned to the experimental unit.

item.title: Missing Data
item.description: Missing data What types of missing data? Missing completely at random Missing at random Missing not at random What technique to handle missing data? Listwise or case deletion： assumption：sample size are large con: simple implement pro: loss given information Pairwise deletion? assumption： not missing here and there, con：compare with the listwise, the lost information reduced pro：cause inaccurate stand error as the knowing Mean substitutionn?

item.title: SAS
item.description: SQL You are given two non-empty linked lists representing two non-negative integers. The digits are stored in reverse order, and each of their nodes contains a single digit. Add the two numbers and return the sum as a linked list. You may assume the two numbers do not contain any leading zero, except the number 0 itself. source For this problem we will begin with the sashelp.baseball data set.

item.title: SQL
item.description: DEFINATION OF RELATION TABLES HOW TO CHANGE THE ENTITY TO A SCHEMAS CASE WHEN SUBQUERY COMMON TABLE EXPRESS (cte) WINDOW FUN ROLLUP and CUBE TABLESAMPLE UNPIVOT:ROW TO COLUMN PIVOT:COLUME TO ROW Some information contains from [Datacamp], you can use my refer link(https://www.datacamp.com/join-me/MjY2NTU1) to get started and learn new technique together. item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
